Title: Great Britain women win 4x400m bronze at World Athletics Relays event
Context: Great Britain's 4x400m women's team won bronze at the 2021 World Athletics Relays event in Silesia in Poland.

Title: Childhood obesity
Context: Childhood obesity, high blood pressure, cholesterol linked to poor cognitive performance in mid-30s and beyond

Title: India's Covid-19 catastrophe could make global shortages even worse
Context: A terrifying and record-breaking wave of Covid-19 in India threatens to stall the country's economic recovery and send shockwaves through several important global industries.

Title: What is TDEE?
Context: Your Total Daily Energy Expenditure (TDEE) is an estimation of how many calories you burn per day when exercise is taken into account.

Title: Spotify adds timestamped podcast sharing and other social features
Context: On the heels of its expanded partnership with Facebook, Spotify this morning announced new sharing features that broaden the way Spotify content, including both music and podcasts, can be shared across social media.

Title: Falling Stars: 10 of the Most Famous Endangered Species
Context: hey’re known as “charismatic megafauna” for a reason. These endangered animals ooze star power, a factor that conservationists have capitalized on in order to fund projects to protect them (and, often by default, the other organisms that share their complex ecosystems).

Title: 16 Paintings You Can See (in Person) Only in Sweden
Context: Earlier versions of the descriptions of these paintings first appeared in 1001 Paintings You Must See Before You Die, edited by Stephen Farthing (2018). Writers’ names appear in parentheses.

Title: Restaurants are ‘sucking wind’ but fighting back to reopen amid a worker shortage
Context: Like many in his field, restaurateur Michael Pasquarello is grateful to have survived the damage the pandemic did to his business and is now looking forward to something that resembles normal.

Title: Where Do Our Memories Live?
Context: A new book explores research through the ages that has tried to map the intricacies of the human brain, including pinpointing the seat of memory.
